page.title: 06Occupations - Calbourne
page.content: The occupations of people living in the area are various. A few are employed within the boundary but most workers commute to nearby towns and two travel to the mainland. Some of the larger houses employ local labour, as do the public house, Post Office, petrol pumps and farms. The local Water Mill, open to the public during the summer months, employs local staff Less men are occupied as farm workers than in the past. One local farm employs men to manufacture agricultural implements. Living within the area are about{64 working persons, {28 retired and 12 not employed outside {the home.}Occupations include: farmers,farm workers, teachers, builders, artists, electricians, mechanics, a doctor, a sailor, a bank official, a prison officer, a nurse, a policeman and a veterinary surgeon.
